description.narrative: The country has strengthened its capacity to implement gender-sensitive child-sensitive policies and procedures, and strategic stakeholders have more evidence on child protection issues.

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Inter-sectoral coordination and collaboration on violence, exploitation and abuse
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Child Protection)
Burundi Country Programme Document 2010-2014 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burundi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The country has strengthened its capacity to implement gender-sensitive child-sensitive policies and procedures, and strategic stakeholders have more evidence on child protection issues.

description.narrative: In 2019, the revision of the National Child Protection Policy and the new National Child Protection code, developed with UNICEF technical assistance, were both submitted to the Council of Ministers for adoption and promulgation. Despite the delay in the development of a system to capture routine data, the child rights monitoring programme recorded 1,679 (1,167 boys and 512 girls) child protection cases that required attention and thus enabling relevant timely assistance to victims and witnesses. Five provinces have developed and implemented child protection action plans. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of laws and policies on child protection revised to be in line with international norms and standards
Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex.
Percentage of districts that have an information management that is inter operable and supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring ( humanitarian)

Country has a national, multi-sectoral plan(s) or strategy(ies) for coordinated action to prevent and respond to violence against children that meets key criteria for quality, according to status of plan.
